metadata.title: CVE-2016-3672 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
The arch_pick_mmap_layout function in arch/x86/mm/mmap.c in the Linuxkernel through 4.5.2 does not properly randomize the legacy base address,which makes it easier for local users to defeat the intended restrictionson the ADDR_NO_RANDOMIZE flag, and bypass the ASLR protection mechanism fora setuid or setgid program, by disabling stack-consumption resource limits.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-3672` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-22-generic - 4.4.0-22.39
linux-image-4.4.0-22-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-22.39
